basics.name: FirstName LastName
basics.label: Ph.D. Student - Integrated Program in Biochemistry
basics.summary: Ph.D. student and protein engineer with extensive experience in synthetic biology, biochemical engineering, high-throughput protein screening, and molecular cloning.

work.name: Ginkgo Bioworks
work.summary: Led R&D program developing a biosensor and ultra-high-throughput in-vivo screen to improve protein biophysical characteristics.
highlights: Managed a cross-company team with a budget over $200K.
Most junior employee to lead a program among +250 programs at Ginkgo.
Designed and implemented FACS experiments in bacterial and yeast systems for protein library screening.
Delivered 14 improved proteins across 8 projects.
Cloned multiple high-quality variant libraries of up to 8 million members.
Used protein design models (EvCouplings, Meta ESM, AgroScan-3D, Protein MPNN) and software (Pymol, Rosetta Design, Schrodinger Maestro).
Analyzed large NGS datasets using Python on AWS infrastructure.
Optimized and wrote protocols (nicking mutagenesis, Golden Gate, yeast electroporation, qPCR, western blot).
Co-founded the Seedling Affinity Group for junior scientist professional development.

work.name: Broad Institute: Genetic Perturbation Platform
work.summary: Created and evaluated large pooled DNA libraries for CRISPR, RNAi, ORF screening.
highlights: Generated custom pooled guide DNA libraries (up to 92,000 variants).
Optimized barcode integration into existing CRISPR pools and adapted lab automation.
Evaluated pool quality using molecular analysis and next-generation sequencing (Python-based QC).
Managed and tracked reagents with a LIMS.
Volunteered night shifts for clinical COVID-19 testing at the peak of the pandemic.

work.name: Biogen
work.summary: Developed rapid purification schemes for Aducanumab and explored alternative purification technologies.
highlights: Designed and executed a continuous membrane-only purification process (2% of standard process time).
Evaluated replacement technologies for Protein A chromatography in monoclonal antibody purification.

work.name: Tufts University, Wolfe Lab
work.summary: Studied the farm biome and cabbage phyllosphere to discover sources of lactobacillus.
highlights: Collected and processed soil and leaf samples from 50+ New England sites.
Extracted and sequenced 16s rRNA to determine bacterial phenology.
Explored origin and growth rates of microbiomes in the cabbage phyllosphere.
Established selective amplification methods for rare lactobacillus populations.
Co-authored two publications on lactic acid bacteria and gnotobiotic systems.

work.name: Repligen
work.summary: Developed improved column packing procedures for agarose and cellulose chromatography resins.
highlights: Increased manufacturing yields from 53% to 79% with a new packing process.
Reduced failure risk in OPUS HPLC column manufacturing.
Tested agarose resins for improved structural properties.

work.name: Repligen
highlights: Performed additional packing studies for OPUS HPLC columns.
Explored best practices in resin manufacturing for robust scale-up.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Recognized for academic excellence in multiple semesters.

publications.name: Establishment Limitation Constrains the Abundance of Lactic Acid Bacteria in the Napa Cabbage Phyllosphere
publications.summary: Discusses constraints on lactic acid bacteria establishment in the cabbage phyllosphere.

publications.name: A Gnotobiotic System for Studying Microbiome Assembly in the Phyllosphere and in Vegetable Fermentation
publications.summary: Describes methods for creating a gnotobiotic system to study microbiome assembly.
